channel.title: Vbulletin
channel.description:
hey i have got vbulletin and when im on the third step it says The database has failed to connect because you do not have permission to connect to the server. Please confirm the values entered in the 'includes/config.php' file.
can anyone help me fix please?

item.title: Vbulletin
item.dc:creator: @ImMoRtAl1 ImMoRtAl-
item.description:
@ImMoRtAl1 wrote:

ok , vb nubs i have 3 legit vb’s running but here is how to do this… chmod config.php to 777 after you rename it to config.php

Read full topic

item.title: Vbulletin
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“Teh Spede, post:2, topic:339100”]For a minute there i thought this was something that i had posted. omgomgomg[/quote]same, i wondered if you were trolling

@op: your database credentials are clearly not correct. re-check the username, password and host in the config file. if it still doesn’t work then create a separate php file and see if you can connect using the standard method - mysql_connect(“host”, “username”, “password”). if that doesn’t work, you don’t have the right credentials.

Read full topic
